label: ham
subject: Re: discussion with the FSF: GPLv3, GFDL, Nexenta
body: 94 (return) [ Diodorus Siculus attests and approves the hereditary succession of the priesthood among the Egyptians, the Chaldeans, and the Indians, (l. i. p. 84, l. ii. p. 142, 153, edit. Wesseling.) The magi are described by Ammianus as a very numerous family: ÒPer s¾cula multa ad pr¾sens un‰ e‰demque prosapi‰ multitudo creata, Deorum cultibus dedicata.Ó (xxiii. 6.) Ausonius celebrates the _Stirps Druidarum_, (De Professorib. Burdigal. iv.;) but we may infer from the remark of C¾sar, (vi. 13,) that in the Celtic hierarchy, some room was left for choice and emulation.]
